com.taursys.xml
Class SelectField

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.taursys.xml.Component
        |
        +--com.taursys.xml.Parameter
              |
              +--com.taursys.xml.AbstractField
                    |
                    +--com.taursys.xml.SelectField
All Implemented Interfaces:
DocumentComponent, MapperComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTMLSelect
public class SelectField
extends AbstractField

A Component which receives selection input and/or renders selected value to a Document. It responds to InputEvents and holds the given value. By default, this component uses a DefaultSelectModel. You can change this by overriding the createDefaultModel method or explicitly setting the model property.

This component can render its value to an xml Document (thru the DocumentAdapter). The id property indicates which element to render in the Document. The attributeName property is only used with an AttributeSelectFieldRenderer to indicate which attribute to store the value in. By default, this component creates and uses a SelectFieldRenderer. Override the createDefaultRenderer or use the setRenderer to use a different renderer.

Constructor Detail

SelectField

public SelectField()
Constructs a new SelectField with a default model and renderer. The default model, a DefaultTextModel, is created via the createDefaultModel method in the Parameter superclass. The default renderer, a TextFieldRenderer, is created via the createDefaultRenderer method.

SelectField

public SelectField(java.lang.Object[] array)
Constructs a new SelectField with a default model, and given object array for list. The default model, a DefaultTextModel, is created via the createDefaultModel method in the Parameter superclass. The default renderer, a TextFieldRenderer, is created via the createDefaultRenderer method. The list is set to an ObjectArrayValueHolder with the given object array.
Method Detail

createDefaultModel

protected TextModel createDefaultModel()
Creates the default TextModel used by this component By default, this method returns a new DefaultSelectModel. Override this method to define your own TextModel.
Overrides:
createDefaultModel in class Parameter

setModel

public void setModel(TextModel newModel)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the Model for this component to the given DefaultSelectModel. Although this component allows passing a TextModel, the given model must be an instanceof DefaultSelectModel.
Overrides:
setModel in class Parameter

setPropertyName

public void setPropertyName(java.lang.String newPropertyName)
Sets the property name in valueHolder that will hold the value from the list. If you have also used the setPropertyNames method, then this will change the first name in that array.
